key_title: Key to the genera of Gentianaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons

leads.lead_text: Calyx and corolla each with 6–12 lobes
Calyx and corolla each with 4 or 5 lobes
Sepals under 2 mm long, fused for at least half their length; tiny, erect, often unbranched, yellow-flowered ephemerals or annuals
Sepals longer than 2 mm, fused for less than half their length; annuals or perennials, usually branched to some degree
Stigma persistent, corolla white, bluish or cream commonly with darker veins or streaks
Stigma deciduous, corolla white, yellow or pink
Leaves sessile; corolla 4–5 lobed to ± one third of corolla length, with smaller often lacerate lobes in between; tube well-developed
At least the lower leaves petiolate (often purplish at the base); corolla deeply 4–5 lobed with a very short tube or tube apparently absent
Ovary 2-locular; capsule shorter than and enclosed by calyx; calyx-lobes connate only near base; flowers yellow or white; anthers not twisting after dehiscence
Ovary 1-locular; capsule equal to or exceeding calyx; calyx-lobes connate for at least one quarter their length; flowers pink or yellow; anthers spirally twisting after dehiscence

Inflorescence a dichasium, often corymbose; corolla not or barely constricted below limb; style slightly usually shortly bifid below stigma; stigma lobes reniform to shoe-shaped, fleshy; capsule cylindric

Inflorescence of spicate monochasia, never corymbose; corolla distinctly constricted below limb, particularly evident in fruit; style not bifid below stigma; stigma not or indistinctly bilobed, the lobes then rhombic to fan-shaped, not fleshy; capsule ellipsoid to ovoid
